qas.question: Who is famous for natural beauty?
What years was the Anglo-Gorkha War?
What does HIma mean in Sanskirt?
What is the literal meaning of Himachal Pradesh?
Who was one of the great sanskirt scholars of Himachal Pradesh?
What is  one thing Britain is famous for?
What came into power after the war between Himachal and Sanskrit?

plausible_answers.text: After the war between Nepal and Britain, also known as the Anglo-Gorkha War (1814–1816)

qas.question: When did the Himalayas become part of the Punjab Province of British India?
Who was responsible for naming the Punjab Province of British India?

context: <a0_0>Himachal Pradesh<a0_0/> is famous for <b6_0>its abundant natural beauty<b6_0/>. <b8_0>After the war between Nepal and Britain, also known as the Anglo-Gorkha War (<a1_0>1814–1816<a1_0/>)<b8_0/>, <b7_0>the British colonial government<b7_0/> came into power and the land now comprising Himachal Pradesh became part of the Punjab Province of British India. In 1950, Himachal was declared <b5_0>a union territory<b5_0/>, but after the State of Himachal Pradesh Act 1971, Himachal emerged as the 18th state of the Republic of India. Hima means <a2_0>snow<a2_0/> in Sanskrit, and the literal meaning of the state's name is "<a3_0>In the lap of Himalayas<a3_0/>". It was named by <a4_0><b9_0>Acharya Diwakar Datt Sharma<b9_0/><a4_0/>, one of the great Sanskrit scholars of Himachal Pradesh.
